p: Debbache et al., tested the potential antifungal activity of 4 types of extracts (ethanol, aqueous ethyl acetate, chloroform and aqueous chloroform) from poplar buds (Province of Amizour, Algeria) on Aspergillus niger and Fusarium polyferatum. Results evaluated by measuring inhibition zones surrounding plant extracts showed that all screened extracts elicit moderate activity against fungal strains (inhibition zones between 6 and 9 mm) [ 7].
